instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01700 A2141 not charging
threads.message:
The board only on desk draws (charger only)5v 0.27A
PPBUS_G3H=12.32v
PP3V3_G3H_RTC=3.3v
System boots with batteryand charger and stay on with battery :PPBUS_G3H=12.32v
PP3V3_G3H_RTC=3.3v..
But not charging..

threads.title: 820-01700 A2141 not charging
threads.message:
Did you test the board alone on the desk with original 96/140W charger?

Check voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: 820-01700 A2141 not charging
threads.message:
I used original 96W charger 

I2C_PWR_SDA=0.466 and 1.799v
I2C_PWR_SCL=0.465 and 1.799v

threads.title: 820-01700 A2141 not charging
threads.message:
When booted with battery, macOS shows battery percentage?

Check UPC_I2C_INT_L.
You still have problems on USB-C areas.

threads.title: 820-01700 A2141 not charging
threads.message:
It shows battery percentage....
The board first came in dead i found short on PP5V_S4_UBC then passed current through it found U3100 get in hot and i replaced it..
Short gone

threads.title: 820-01700 A2141 not charging
threads.message:
UPC_I2C_INT_L diode mode to ground is 0.510
With 0volt

threads.title: 820-01700 A2141 not charging
threads.message: Some peoples on Internet claim that this board only accepts CD3217 chips from same model scrap board.

threads.title: 820-01700 A2141 not charging
threads.message: I should find exact board and replace the cd3217

threads.title: 820-01700 A2141 not charging
threads.message: The system is not entering DFU
